attributes.action: Make all BBC board of directors all subject to election by UK electorate
attributes.background: To ensure those in ultimate charge of BBC ensure what it broadcasts or publishes is genuinely unbiased have a board of directors that is periodically subject to election by proportional representation by the general UK electorate

attributes.action: HM Government must ensure that UK can unilaterally withdraw from Brexit backstop
attributes.background: As a truly sovereign nation, HM Government must ensure that the UK can unilaterally withdraw from the Brexit backstop arrangement as described in the Draft Withdrawal Agreement of the UK from the EU. Otherwise the sovereignty of the UK could be lost forever.

attributes.action: Remove Abellio Greater Anglia from servicing the Greater Anglia rail network.
attributes.background: The Abellio Greater Anglia service worsens on a monthly basis, all the while annually raising rail fares inexplicably. Cancellations, regularly late running trains, reduced carriages, overcrowding, extortionate fares. No remorse for their customers & no sign of reinvestment in the service. Get rid!
attributes.additional_details:
I am lucky if my daily commute from Bishop's Stortford to London is ever on time or disrupted in one way or another. I pay approximately  £500 a month, or £6,000 for a service which is miles away from being worth it, but I am left with little option to get to work each day (if I'm lucky).

Fares have beeing increased nearly 10% in the last 4 years and there have been no improvements made. Broken down trains which don't get replaced. Trains are late EVERY DAY. Trains are overcrowded.

attributes.action: Review maternity and paternity law for birth of premature babies
attributes.background: I feel there should be extended leave for mothers maternity i.e paid leave from when the baby is born and then maternity leave to start once the baby is medically discharged and also for fathers to I.e 2 weeks off for baby being born and also 2 weeks from when they are medically discharged.
attributes.additional_details: My wife had a emergency c section on the 16th September to our 28 week old baby son called Finley. We have been in hospital for over 8 weeks and hopefully be home by the end of November. I as a parent have no parental leave for when my baby comes home and my wife has already lost 2 months of her maternity leave and our baby isn’t out of hospital yet.

attributes.action: Stop uninsured drivers by increasing fines to £1000+
attributes.background:
In March 2018 we were hit by an uninsured driver. I was left with 7 broken bones, an operation, 7 days in hospital and the ongoing prospect of an 18 month recovery period.

The magistrates have banned the driver for 6 months and fined them just £120 for this offence.
attributes.additional_details: I ask for your support to get the Government to review the current fines imposed to be more reflective of the crime. £120 is less than the cost of most insurance cover and therefore not a deterrent. I propose a minimum fine of £1000+ to stop people driving without insurance.

attributes.action: The UK should create a Blockchain Act to support the new tokenized economy
attributes.background: Our legal infrastructure needs to provide a foundation for proper digital signing with private keys, and support the legal consequences of the ownership, possession and transfer of tokens.
attributes.additional_details:
A Blockchain Act will support the new tokenized economy, and where real-world applications around blockchain can be enacted with legal certainty. These tokens include: payment tokens (currency coins); utility tokens (services); and security tokens (equity and assets). 

Liechtenstein's Blockchain Act defines its objective as to:

"enable the transformation of the ‘real’ world to blockchain systems while ensuring legal certainty, thereby opening up the full application potential of the token economy."

The UK Act should aim to define “legal certainty” for blockchain implementation and projects, and define a world where our existing assets are added onto blockchain, and then traded there.

attributes.action: Incentivise the use of the river Thames as a transport mode for freight
attributes.background:
Having operated vessels on the Thames, I am saddened by the surrounding decline of practical opportunities for utilising our glorious river sustainably for freight.

We must ask government to assess whether enough resource is available for industry to thrive and prefer water transport over road.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, yet again commuters using the M25 are stranded due to a HGV freight collision closing the QEII bridge.
Whilst this may seem unrelated, our small vessels pass underneath, with nearly no other vessels in site for miles.
A free, reliable transport mode able to move thousands of tonnes a day and relieve the neighbouring roads of HGV movements.
Why is more not being done to retain the use of the waterways?  Shipyards are in decline.  Skills are in decline.  We must act, before it is too late

attributes.action: Stop the slaughtering of farmed animals for human consumption.
attributes.background: Animals are forcibly impregnated, kept in closed and confined spaces, stunned (although in some cases like Halal slaughterhouses they are not stunned) and slaughtered.
attributes.additional_details:
As the superior species, we should help and protect animals now that we have adapted to create alternatives, like burgers out of plant foods!
 
Relevant documentaries:
Cowspiracy Documentary:  https://www.netflix.com/title/80033772 
What the Health: https://www.netflix.com/title/80174177?s=i”

attributes.action: Make it a legal obligation for businesses to turn all lights off after close.
attributes.background: The large majority of business's in the UK will keep lights running throughout the night in order to advertise their company. On a large scale this is a huge waste of our resources and banning this act could be a simple step to significantly reduce our countries impact on the environment.

attributes.action: Get rid of the 5% luxury tax that women have to pay on sanitary products.
attributes.background: It is discrimination against women to have to pay a luxury tax on a necessity, as men do not have to pay for any necessities. Many young girls miss out on their education because they're unable to afford sanitary items to wear.
attributes.additional_details: Our goal is to get rid of the 5% luxury tax that women have to pay on sanitary products as people can't afford it.

attributes.action: Free dental treatment for steroid-dependant patients
attributes.background: Steroid-dependant patients need an exemption from paying for dental treatment. Addison’s disease sufferers are steroid dependant, which damages teeth and bones. We have no choice, it is just like a diabetic needing insulin, yet we have to pay dental costs and they don't.
attributes.additional_details:
More information is available at the Addison’s Support Group at www.addisons.org.uk
The British Dental Association will confirm steroids do cause damage to your teeth. 
It also affects our bones. Many of us suffer from osteoporosis too.

attributes.action: Full ban on the purchase of fireworks & displays.
attributes.background: Firework explosions are producing blind panic in animals that are lead to serious injury, deep-rooted, debilitating fears and death. The explosion of fireworks also releases poisonous chemicals and particle-laden smoke, contaminating our natural environment. A ban on public use will simply not work.
attributes.additional_details:
The explosion of a firework which can emit sounds of up to 190 decibels, a full 110 to 115 decibels higher than the 75- to 80-decibel range, where damage to the human ear begins & is proportionately more disturbing to for an animal. 

There is an evident need to protect both companion animals and wild animals from fireworks harm, and this need is growing with each passing year. A ban on public use only protects domesticated animals and forget about wildlife.

attributes.action: Modernise and Amend The Highways Act of 1835
attributes.background: The Highways Act of 1835 is preventing Tech Startups and Global Business specialising in PLEV's (Personal Light Electronic Vehicle) from trading in the UK. It will also increase capacity of our cities by getting people off public transport and having fewer cars on the road.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see... http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Will4/5-6/50/section/LXXII/enacted

The purpose of this partition is to ask the government to change the law so that PLEV's (Electronic Scooters)can be ridden in public areas. Currently they are banned from both Pavements and Roads. PLEV's are a cost effective environmentally friendly emission free way of getting around a city. PLEV's also need a classification as a vehicle type as a part of this in the same way as Electronic Bikes are classified

attributes.action: Employ IDVA's (independent domestic violence advocate) in ALL family courts
attributes.background:
Employ IDVA's in EVERY family & magistrate court to advise on ALL cases involving domestic abuse. 

They are highly qualified and trained in all areas of DA so therfore vital to ALL cases involving it for fair and factual hearings.

The courts can ONLY then make INFORMED decisions for each case.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 women, 1 in 5 children & 1 in 6 men experience domestic abuse with a vast number ending up through family or magistrates court. 

Currently many survivors are representing themselves in a system UNTRAINED in this area. 

For an informed and fair outcome for all it is ESSENTIAL to have the expertise of an IDVA who can advise courts on all cases where DA has been claimed.

https://www.naccc.org.uk/downloads/NewsItems/APPG_Inquiry_report_Domestic_Abuse_Child_Contact_and_the_Family_Court.pdf

attributes.action: Ban the use of all domestic Wood Burning Stoves and Log Burners
attributes.background: Every year more people have wood burning appliances installed in their homes to the detriment of air quality everywhere. There is a wealth of evidence available from numerous sources to show how damaging PM2.5 particulates are from burning solid fuels and their contribution to air pollution.
attributes.additional_details: Despite DEFRA's own report (see link) very little is being done to tackle this problem. https://uk-air.defra.gov.uk/assets/documents/reports/cat11/1708081027_170807_AQEG_Biomass_report.pdf  This petition is to force DEFRA to take proactive action and ban wood burning before this too becomes a national health risk, as diesel emissions have become. Under the radar the problem with burning solid fuels has re-emerged due to a totally unnecessary fashion accessory and status symbol.

attributes.action: Reduce the TV license fee and privatise the BBC
attributes.background:
The BBC was created as a government funded TV channel when there were very few other options. Today, with hundreds of alternative channels, the BBC is not needed.

The TV license should ONLY be for maintenance of broadcasting equipment, and the BBC should be self funded like all other TV channels.
attributes.additional_details:
Our proposal is to make the BBC a privately funded channel, as all others are, with commercials and/or subscription fees. Approximately 11% of license fees are spent on the infrastructure and broadcasting equipment, the rest is spent on BBC programming and administation,  and chasing license fees. 

By making the BBC private, more people will be able to watch live TV without having to pay a hefty fee for a service they don't use.

attributes.action: Condemn the violence by the French Police on GiletsJaunes protestors
attributes.background: Across social media and news outlets, there is evidence on tactics used by the French police which causes physical harm, including to peaceful protestors. Some of these protestors include students and journalists. The UK should condemn this violence.
attributes.additional_details:
Flashballs are used on protestors that can physically harm them, put them in comas and in some cases make them lose an eye.
 
https://www.hrw.org/news/2018/12/14/france-police-crowd-control-methods-maim-people 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/world-europe-46917989

attributes.action: Repeal The Vagrancy Act 1824
attributes.background:
The Vagrancy Act 1824 makes it an offence to sleep rough or beg.

It is a barbaric, archaic law that criminalises the very existence of those homeless forced to take to the streets or beg for survival.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland & Ireland removed this outdated law decades ago - England & Wales must join them.

This legislation remains in force and in use. The Government currently has no plans to make changes to the law.

attributes.action: Make newspapers print retractions the same font, size and page as the original
attributes.background: Brexit has highlighted how the press (both sides) run stories that significantly impact and influence voters and often maintain dispute rather than promoting debate. Stories are later proven untrue and a tiny apology is printed at the back of the paper. This apology should match the original story.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is an example of such a retraction...

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10156952942302272&set=a.10150366579832272&type=3&theater

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares to anyone under 18, by law.
attributes.background: The legal age of adulthood is 18 in the UK. Yet many transport operators require children of a certain age to buy a full-fare ticket, intended for adults. Young people cannot work full-time and we should be supporting them, rather than offering fares which exploit and disadvantage children.
attributes.additional_details: Most trains in the UK are an example of how the fares system fails to support those who are in full-time education, and who are the future of our country. Fares continue to be structured as though it is the last century, when far less 16 and 17 year olds were in education. Both bus and train operators are guilty of exploiting young people, through fares and fines. A new law would create a sense of consistency and equality for all children using public transport in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce tougher penalties for commercial fly-tipping
attributes.background:
Millions of pounds of taxpayer's money is spent clearing up behind these unscrupulous criminals, the current legislation does not appear to be an effective deterrent.

The cost of clearance to local authorities in England in 2017/18 was £12.2 million, for large fly-tipping incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Parliament to debate the illegal industrial sized fly-tipping that blights our nation. Specifically, the petition calls for Parliament to debate: 

(i)   Whether the relevant enforcement agencies are adequately resourced to enforce existing legislation?
(ii)  Whether current legislation is being implemented robustly by Her Majesty's Court Service?
(iii) Whether Parliament needs to consider passing new legislation to provide an effective deterrent?

attributes.action: Improve the treatment and diagnosis of Thoracic Outlet Syndrome on the NHS.
attributes.background: TOS is a condition in which the flow of blood or nerves are restricted to one or both arms. Despite the fact it creates debilitating and disabling symptoms, at present the current understanding and treatment on the NHS is very poor, often taking several years to even diagnose, if at all.
attributes.additional_details:
It can cause a range of symptoms including the pulse completely dropping from the limb as soon as it is raised, to extreme weakness and pain in the affected side. In rare cases it can even lead to blood clots and strokes.

I have personally been experiencing symptoms for 3 years, having initially been told by a doctor I was "imagining" my symptoms, which is a very common, devastating reaction faced by sufferers. The condition is serious and often requires the removal of a rib to treat.

attributes.action: To reform the PIP assessment process for people affected by mental illness
attributes.background:
The PIP assessment process is inadequate & aimed primarily at people with physical illness.

There should be two forms one for physical illness & one for mental illness 

All assessors & DWP decision-makers to be appropriately trained in mental health to understand the impact on the assessed.
attributes.additional_details:
I run an art group for all those severely affected by mental illness. I watch many members of my group experience all sorts of anxieties before, during and after their PIP assessments. 
I have developed the following solutions in consultation with the charity Rethink Mental Illness.
Time and time again, my group members and thousands of others, wait for long periods before receiving their results, often to be told they have been awarded nil points.

attributes.action: Revoke A50 then hold a new referendum with a 55% supermajority requirement
attributes.background: Since the last referendum was advisory and required only a simple majority, the small majority difference has caused immense recriminations. To bring the nation together, Revok Article 50, then have a referendum that requires 55% majority to leave or remain giving a clear 10% decisive difference

attributes.action: Make the medical complaints process work for bereaved parents.
attributes.background: In 2013, my son died due to medical negligence. It has taken 4.5 long painful years to get answers and some kind of justice. The Government must review how medical complaints are handled and investigated to ensure that loved ones don’t have long and painful fights for the truth.
attributes.additional_details: Having a baby die is traumatic enough without having to put your grief on hold to fight for answers. We just need to know the truth. Clear procedures must be in place to ensure that we get the truth as quickly as possible. I really hope you can help me and other families who face the death of a child due to medical negligence.

attributes.action: Make a law for causing serious injury by careless driving with severe penalties
attributes.background: My son received catastrophic life changing injuries in a RTA. The CPS could only charge the driver with careless driving and nothing more serious. All he got was £750 fine and 8 points, the most the judge could impose. There needs to be a law for causing serious injury by careless driving.
attributes.additional_details: There are stiff penalties for death caused by careless driving, serious injury caused by dangerous driving but there is nothing for serious injury caused by careless driving. This is not just, people are getting away with a slapped wrist, there is no deterrent to make people think before driving carelessly. People’s lives are being turned upside down and the judges are powerless to impose stiffer penalties. This has to be changed.

attributes.action: Increase funding for schools with SEN students.
attributes.background: We are a GCSE Citizenship group and we feel that, due to the recent school budget cuts, Special education needs students are not getting the full support that they deserve, because the funding has been cut for them.
attributes.additional_details:
Our school has been greatly effected by the cuts, and we are now having to use other students money to support these SEN students. If this cause was bought before Parliament, we could increase the spending on SEN students and they would not have to suffer any more than they already are. We have lost £279 per student and we are losing more to help other students.

Our aims are to get as many signatures as possible and hopefully get local MP's behind us.
Please help us.

attributes.action: Stop commission and bonuses being used to make up minimum wage.
attributes.background:
The national minimum wage is put there to allow people to have what is perceived to be a minimum amount required to live yet companies use performance related bonuses to achieve this figure.
They should be separate and minimum basic salary be one thing with performance related bonuses another.

attributes.action: A residency qualification of 5 years to sufficient for full UK voting rights.
attributes.background: My Swedish wife has been here for 36 years and is barred from voting in GEs and referenda. This is an affront to any acceptable standard of democracy. She works and pays taxes here, and has had a National Insurance Number for many years. Sign if you can see that this is deeply undemocratic.
attributes.additional_details: It is simple. There should be no taxation without representation, and people who have shown their commitment to the UK for 5 years or more are, in my view, entitled to have a say in how the country is governed. Anything else is clearly unfair, undemocratic, and unacceptable.

attributes.action: Let the whole UK electorate vote for City mayors.
attributes.background: Cities are the most important hubs in any country, so the Mayor should be elected nationwide, by a wider electorate.

attributes.action:
Stop DVLA Selling owner details to 
Parking Companies/non emergency services.
attributes.background: DVLA make a lot of Money passing on owners details to car parking Companies who believe they are owed money and want exorbitant amounts.
attributes.additional_details: Smart Parking in Basildon is one example of where the parking companies ticket machines are faulty and they deny there is a problem with them.

attributes.action: Abolish Inheritance Tax
attributes.background:
Abolish Inheritance Tax. It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed

We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again.
attributes.additional_details:
Abolish Inheritance Tax. It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed

We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again. 
We believe that the Government should be bold enough to act and axe this iniquitous tax
Nobody should have to pay tax after death, to give their loved ones their hard worked possessions/money.

attributes.action: Add an exemption to the Ivory Bill for the Sikh Kirpan.
attributes.background: Baptised Sikhs are permitted by UK law to carry the ceremonial knife called the Kirpan. Many Kirpans are inherited heirlooms & most historic, antique versions contain ivory handles. We want exemption for Sikhs to be able to carry previously, legally purchased antique Kirpans under the new ivory law.
attributes.additional_details: We do not support the trade in ivory, we are only requesting protection & continued freedom of use of any antique Kirpan legally owned before the new ivory law comes into action. As mentioned, historic Kirpans could contain more than 10% ivory. As many practicing Sikhs will continue to travel abroad, we are very concerned that the Kirpan, if constructed of ivory may be confiscated or destroyed. We request that suitable exemptions are put in place to avoid disruption to the Sikh community.

attributes.action: Referendum to join the EU on the 30th of March 2019
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU on the 29th of March 2019. There will be no second referendum for leaving the EU. The applicant accepts this.

However, the applicant strongly believes that there should be a referendum for joining the EU again on the 30th of March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
The 2016 referendum was overshadowed by misinformation from both sides, scaremongering and possibly foreign interference. 

The voters did not fully understand what the EU is or the impact on their lives and the UK as a whole. 

This petition is no attempt to change the fact that the UK is leaving the EU.

However, and in the name of democracy, the voters should enjoy a referendum to decide if the UK should join the EU again after the 29th of March 2019.

For Queen & Country,

attributes.action: Allow carers who have SGO/parental responsibility paid time off work
attributes.background: We are currently fostering a baby under kinship care however looking at applying for special guardianship and need to be able to give him the time he deserves without being penalised financially
attributes.additional_details: You get paid leave from work if you give birth to a child or adopt a child.  If you gain parental responsibly any other way eg SGO which comes under the adoption act there is no paid time to bond, get them settled in thier forever home and for the new parents.  These children and parents have the same rights responsibilities and needs of any parent/child often more so depending on the child's background.  I believe there should be leave similar to adoption leave allowed in these circumstances.

attributes.action: Do NOT introduce the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' to the UK. Decriminalise instead!
attributes.background: The proposed implementation in the UK of the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' in regards to sex buyer laws criminalises the client and not the sex worker. However, this criminalisation punishes the sex worker by abolishing their market and source of income, whilst making trafficked women harder to find.
attributes.additional_details: Sex workers and women who are forced to sell sex are two separate groups.Yet the Nordic Model assumes that the act of buying sex is inherently violent towards women,this is wrong.Currently for sex workers it's (and should always be),the individual's choice who to have sex with and/or charge for sex. A separate market exists for trafficked women & children and a blanket ban won't help. http://theconversation.com/the-nordic-model-of-prostitution-law-is-a-myth-21351

attributes.action: Require all fast food restaurants & coffee shops to use paper lids on drinks.
attributes.background: The UN has cofirmed that there is just 12 years left to reverse the damage done to our climate. Plastic is a huge contributing factor to the damage that has already taken place. Following paper straws, we need to introduce paper lids to reduce unnessecary plastic usage!
attributes.additional_details:
United Nations Report: http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/

https://www.theloop.ca/we-only-have-12-years-left-to-fix-climate-change-before-were-totally-screwed/

How plastic is damaging the earth:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/environment/plastic-how-planet-earth-environment-oceans-wildlife-recycling-landfill-artificial-a7972226.html%3famp

BBC’s “Drowning in Plastic” documentes the damage that has occurred through plastic usage.

attributes.action: Please protect our treasured St Helens beach huts with Listed Structure status.
attributes.background:
8 October 2018 Isle of Wight County Press article "The Isle of Wight's historic railway carriage beach huts at centre of redevelopment discussions" http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16967980.the-isle-of-wights-historic-railway-carriage-beach-huts-at-centre-of-redevelopment-discussions/
 Save our beach!
attributes.additional_details: The beach huts alongside St Helens beach are old railway carriages and part of our national heritage. They deserve to be preserved and conserved against the whims and fancies of developers. Why should we have to destroy our village life to suit the tastes of developers? These beach huts are part of the "setting" of St Helens Fort, a scheduled monument and Listed Building Grade II. As such this should be considered as part of the Historic Environment and be properly protected by the Government.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of filtered cigarettes across the UK.
attributes.background: It is widely accepted that cigarette filters have little to no health benefits for smokers. Many understand that cigarette filters contain large amounts of toxic chemicals but most people do not realise they contain plastic and are the biggest ocean pollutant on the planet.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 4.5 trillion cigarette butts find their way into the environment every single year. It's estimated that a cigarette butt will take 10-12 years to break down.

By banning cigarette filters we could eliminate a massive percentage of plastic/litter finding its way to our streets, rivers and oceans almost overnight benefiting us, wildlife and the environment. It's likely to encourage more smokers to give up too.

attributes.action: Lower the age for breast cancer screening and make it more frequent
attributes.background:
My mum was diagnosed with Breast cancer after a routine screening which showed a 50p size lump in the middle of her breast. 
My mum was diagnosed with stage 4 terminal cancer that had spread to her liver and lungs. She later passed away.
If I can help anyone it’s worth a try
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 454,000 cases of breast cancer every year in the UK and 1 in 8 people are likely to contract the disease in their life. 
If we can find it early we can not only save peoples lives but save the NHS money

attributes.action: Use EU law to restrict immigration to people who support themselves or find work
attributes.background: EU laws, employed successfully in Belgium and other EU countries, enable members to restrict immigration to those who can support themselves or find a job in a limited time period. If Article 50 is withdrawn or a Peoples Vote called, parliament should commit to controlling immigration in this way
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 the then-Prime Minister deemed that implementing these controls would be too expensive despite the fact they're used across the EU with great success.
 
I'm certain there's a majority for remaining in the EU if the UK implements these tougher controls to address many leave voters’ concerns. There is an implementation cost but it'd be far cheaper and less damaging than Brexit.

attributes.action: Recognise The Windrush Generation & make them all automatically British citizens
attributes.background: In 1948 hundreds from the Carribean answered the call from the motherland to help rebuild the UK. Many continued to arrive with their families until 1971 & under the 1948 national immigration act were automatically granted British citizenship. It's time to make all of that generation British.
attributes.additional_details: David Lammy called for recognition of the Windrush Generation & many more.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to carry any knife in public without good reason.
attributes.background: A knife point can cause serious injury or kill at a depth of just 2cm . Therefore why is it legal to carry a knife that has a folding blade with a cutting edge 3 inches long or less. No knife should be carried on UK streets.

attributes.action: Stop rail strikes by legislating!
attributes.background: For too long the RMT has caused misery to the daily lives of millions of people up and down the country! For the good of the country, especially during this turbulent time of BREXIT, this needs to STOP!
attributes.additional_details: https://michaelbradleysblog.wordpress.com/2018/10/26/why-are-the-rmt-striking/

attributes.action: Reduce VAT and explore alternatives to business rates across the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Owner of Michelin-starred restaurant Pied-à-Terre, David Moore, wants action to be taken to save businesses and jobs with a thorough review of a sales tax as an alternative to business rates and a reduction on VAT for food sales.
attributes.additional_details: The restaurant businesses on the High Street which employ hundreds of thousands of people in the UK are trying to support their families all over the country and need urgent help to survive.

attributes.action: National Government to decide planning applications for land sold by councils
attributes.background: Local councils hold and own lots of land. If they choose to sell this land it is in the councils best interests to pass any planning application applied for on the land. Once the planning application is approved the council will benefit from the sale. There is a conflict of interest that must cease.
attributes.additional_details: Stafford Borough Council (SBC) are selling a large piece of land at Tilling Drive in Stone Staffs for a lot of money, subject to planning permission. It is therefore in SBC's interest to approve planning consent on this land. It is wrong for a council selling land to also give permission to develop the land. I believe a conflict of interest exists. In such circumstances a government body should manage any planning application to ensure true open and honest government. All ambiguities should be removed from the process and due diligence applied.

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastics.
attributes.background:
No matter your stance on the EU, to ban single-use plastics was a smart move and should be enforced by the UK.

In 2015, plastic packaging waste accounted for 47% of plastic waste. 2017 alone produced a total of 400 million tons of plastic waste. (Single-Use Plastics, UN Env. Programme '18)
attributes.additional_details:
Likewise, the deposit system for plastic bottles and tin/aluminium cans should be enforced to ensure the return of these items to locations where they can be recycled. Waste and waste sorting cost will therefore naturally diminish.

So:
- BAN single-use plastics*
- Introduce a nationwide deposit system for plastic/aluminium bottles/cans

* single-use pastics include straws, coffee stirrers, styrofoam take-away cups/containers, milk jugs, toiletry containers, and more.

Thanks for your attention.

attributes.action: Make the Be Kind Campaign mandatory at all schools in England
attributes.background: Bullying is a range of behaviours including verbal abuse, physical, emotional, cyber and online bulling. We are seeing children as young as 10 years old killing themselves because teachers are not listening to them or safeguarding them. This Campaign could help children get the support they need.
attributes.additional_details:
In July 2018 I did my first column for the Express & Star newspaper stating that all schools should join and support the Be Kind Campaign
 
Since then I have had several people contact me with regard to the experience their child has had with bullying at school. It's now time to make a change and be that change, for the sake of our children.
 
https://www.expressandstar.com/news/voices/opinions/talking-point/2018/07/19/all-schools-should-join-the-be-kind-campaign/

attributes.action: Put mandatory ethical labelling on all imported consumer goods
attributes.background: The British Government should introduce a compulsory ‘ethical labelling’ system on all imported items, similar to the ‘traffic-light’ system used in food.This would cover four areas of concern: worker pay; human welfare; environmental impact and animal cruelty.
attributes.additional_details: This labelling would empower shoppers who are unknowingly helping to destroy the environment and exploit some of the poorest workers in the developing world by buying products which they do not know are unethical. Industries from food to fashion are relentlessly driving for profit no matter what the cost. A new easily understood and comprehensive system of labelling would inform decisions and transform the lives of millions of people.

attributes.action: Reform company car tax for diesel and ultra-low emission vehicles.
attributes.background:
Support UK fleets, businesses and drivers by:
- Reducing the 4% diesel company car tax levy until RDE2 testing is commonplace.
- Introduce the ULEV company car tax bands in April 2019, not 2020.
